newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Plantation & Development unit wins KL contract.
newsitem.headline: Plantation & Development unit wins KL contract.

text.p: Plantation & Development (M) Bhd said one of its units has been awarded the main contract valued at 180 million ringgit for the construction of a shopping and commercial complex in Kuala Lumpur.
Invescor Ventures, a wholly-owned unit of Plantation, will begin work on the project in early November, Plantation said in a statement to the Kuala Lumpur Stock Exchange late on Thursday.
The project comprises a five-storey shopping mall, two office towers and a 27-storey business hotel located in Kuala Lumpur.
Metro Jelita Sdn Bhd is the developer of the project.
Plantation said the project is not expected to have any material impact on earnings for 1996.
